conclusion: Determine the amount of charge passing through R1 after switch S is opened.
Initial setup with switch closed: Circuit powered by electromotive force E = 10 V.
Capacitors C1 and C2 are in parallel with resistors R1 and R2, respectively.
Voltage across each capacitor is equal to the supply voltage E = 10 V due to negligible internal resistance.
Charge on capacitor is given by Q = C * V.
Charge Q1 on C1 is 300 μC.
Charge Q2 on C2 is 300 μC.
After switch is opened: Capacitors C1 and C2 start discharging through resistors R1 and R2.
Circuit becomes a series circuit with C1, R1, C2, and R2.
Total charge Q_total = Q1 + Q2 = 600 μC is redistributed between capacitors.
Final charge on each capacitor in series is half of the total initial charge.
Final charge on C1 and C2 is 300 μC.
Charge passing through R1 is the difference between initial and final charge on C1.
No charge passes through R1 since initial and final charge on C1 is 300 μC.
Amount of charge passing through R1 after switch S is opened is 0 μC.
